Posts.Content: Chemo went okay - although I freaked a bit with the cold cap as I found it incredibly painful for the first 10 mins (as they said it would be). Nurses were absolutely fabulous and reassuring. Felt a little bit sick yesterday eve but they said I could take my sleeping tablet which helped as I did get about 4 hours good sleep. Home now and just chilling out and feeling less and less unwell already......... but just waiting to see what other side effects are coming. Thanks for the support and have a good weekend. Jet x
Posts.Title: 1st chemo

Posts.Content: Hi I am having my first session on Thursday - FEC - very worried about being able to cope with it all. Read loads and done as much preparation as possible but feel I am entering a dark tunnel!
Posts.Title: 1st chemo

Posts.Content: Renee - I totally agree with you. My breast had actually ached for a few weeks and seemed to moreso after an exercise class - it was this that made me carry out a more thorough self examination. The shock of actually finding a lump was tremendous. I saw my GP on 25th March, referred to Breast Clinic on 28th March where I had a mammogram, ultrascan and core biopsy and my consultant warned me from the initial results that it was a cancerous lump. Turned out I had a 37mm Grade 3 medullary type cancer but no node involvement. I am 53 and I had had a clear mammogram 18 months ago. No history of any cancer at all in the family. Had lumpectomy in April and started 1st session of 6 FEC chemo on 14th May. 20 rad treatments to follow + herceptin + tamoxifan.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer TNT, in Lymph Node but not spread anywhere else

Posts.Content: Hi Tess Sooo hard not saying anything but I am going to wait until the night before the appt  and prepare him with the copious amount of print offs I have.  I don't want my children to know just yet and I know he would need to share it with them - better to wait until we have seen the neurosurgeon and get a fuller picture.  Busy at work so keeping me occupied but some very dark moments at times. Enough  of that - how are you eyelashes and eyebrows growing?  Decided as well as having hair extensions for my son's wedding I am going for the hollywood glamour permanent eyelashes.....  Got a fab bargain - dress from Harrods reduced from £1100 to £179 - it was just waiting for me... so I will go down fighting that's for sure!! Jet xx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Hi Tess - I guess there are several companies - Lucinda Ellery was featured in a mag I was reading and their website is lucindaellery-hairloss.co.uk.  My hair sounds like yours - some long thin strands sort of giving the overall length with lots of bitty strands at all different stages of growth.  My top looks a bit lumpy and fuzzy with all the new hair.  The medi extensions I will have are real hair but thinner than normal ones so less pull on the real hair.  They give you a personal quotation as to what is needed and the price.  Apparently you can do everything as normal but you wouldn't obviously use irons near the bond.  Although I am desperate they advised it would be more beneficial to wait for a couple of months to get the extra growth with the extensions I wanted.  Not sure if there is anywhere similar more south coast? Decided to take wig on hols - I can wear a hat during the day and just slap on the wig for the evening without having to faff about trying to get my hair to look presentable!!  I am going to have a fab holiday and live for today. Lol Jet xx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Thanks Edith.  I have now have a file on AN alongside the file for BC - a year ago I was totally oblivious to all of this!!  I agree knowledge is power and I will take as long and get as many opinions as I feel I need as I don't think I can deal with each diagnosis  in isolation.  Hope your husband's operation goes well.  Where he is having it?  Wishing you both all the best Jet x
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Hi Tess Have appt for Wed 3rd at 9.30 - which means we will have to leave home at 7.30 am.   As a good friend says ' you are here for a good time not a long time' so enjoy it all. Jet xx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Hi Tess and Edith My appointment is Wed at 9.30 at Cambridge - I live in Bedfordshire so about a 2 hour trip at that time of the morning.  Have got all my questions and research.  My onocologist said he knows very little about ANs and will need to have a letter from the neurosurgeon.  Have all my BC paperwork in case the neurosurgeon says the same about BC.  (To think this time last year I was medically ignorant!). Tess - are you having the extensions  done tomorrow?  Very envious as am waiting until next month for mine.  I am sure they will look fab and will make you feel terrific.  Edith - know what you mean and I am sure your husband will be fine.  Thinking of you - let us know how the operation goes. Lol Jet xx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Hi Tess/Edith Have told the news to hubby - earlier than I wanted but he was confused as to why I needed him to come to the hospital re my hearing as I am usually very independent (had both babies without him even being at the hospital - more by chance than design!).  He is devastated - once is bad enough, twice is  so so awful. Broke down during my Herceptin appt today  when my lovely chemo nurse asked how I got on with the scan last time (as we had to ask her to come down to the MRI unit to help inject me with the special fluid).  All in all a pretty yukky day. Jet xx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Hi Edith Thought Ihad posted a reply but couldn't find it.  So glad your husband's operation went well - and he has done really well coming home so quickly.  Spookily a friend of my daughter's who I know quite well had this 14 months ago - he had no choice but to have an operation and he has made a brilliant recovery.  Looking back he did say he perhaps should have taken things a little easier going back to work too early.  It is amazing though how the body repairs itself.  Let us know how you are getting on. Tess - hope your first day back to work went okay?  I was really nervous about going back after 4 months off  last year......like being the new girl again (and I have worked for the company for 20 years!) although there were quite a few people who hadn't even realised I had been off for more than 2 weeks (including the car park attendant)!!.  Of course taking your clothes off might help any promotion or appraisals....?! Mossies love me (got bites the size of plums in Boreno a couple of years ago + had to see the doctor every day and  stay out of the water)  so took double strength jungle gel for Sri Lanka + Dr prescribed some antibiotics in case I got any bites that became infected again.   But was fine - perhaps the chemo is still in the system and not attractive to the little blighters!! Jet xx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Hi Tess So envious of you heading off to the sun - especially with the Easter weather we have been promised!!  We have decided to clear out our loft so have roped in the kids to come over to sort through all the various games, books and old toys they have stashed away over the last 15 years.  So whilst you are slapping on the suncream I will be forgaging around in the dust and foam insulation!!  Hubby is a bit of a minimalist so will have a fight on my hands but then I have put things like old plates up there in case the kids wanted them when they moved out (yeah - like they would ever?!)    Tess  - how long are you away for?  No don't have to stay in for 6 weeks but may have to stay over 3-4 days depending on how I feel.  At the moment I am feeling pretty fatigued - not sure if is the after effects of the rads as I did read somewhere that you can get a delayed reaction 6 months after treatment.  Normally I am full of energy but I do feel very lethargic and tired. Edith - how is your hubby doing?  Is he being a good patient? Have a brilliant holiday ~Tess - and bring back some sunshine. Jetxx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Hi Edith and Tess Edith - good to hear your husband is making a good recovery so quickly.  Perhaps with the better weather coming he will find it easier to potter around and not expect too much from himself.  Has he got to have follow up appts and how often ?  I have loads of info (a drawer full) and questions - not sure the doctors will be able to answer them all!!  Tess - poor you.  Not sure what a PE is?  Have you got to come off Tamoxifen now?  Still you are on a major countdown now to Egypt! Seeing the specialist onc in ANs tomorrow morning in Cambridge.  Hopefully it won't take the 2 hours to get there as it did the last time.  Just preparing for it when I got sidetracked ...! Jetx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Hi Tess Back from our lovely holiday.  Weather was 40c and the sea was like a bath.  I enjoyed the sun but was careful about covering up and keeping to the shade.  I haven't told my husband yet - I have an appointment in 2 weeks time to see the neurosurgeon.   He is coming with me but I haven't enlightened him yet as to why... I  am feeling  pretty screwed up at times and told a couple of close girlfriends. Back to hols - didn't bother taking the wig and just made do.  You are doing really well - I finished chemo end of Aug and stopped wearing my wig beginning of Nov.  I do feel my hair is still rubbish though as it is very fine and flyaway. Jet xx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Hi Tess Bet you can't wait until your hols - when are you going?  Even with what is happening the holiday we had in Sri Lanka was so good - just nice to get out and enjoy the sunshine. Have a meeting with a new onc on 22nd re my AN - see what she says about any side effects of treatment.  Beginning to think I could do a hospital tripadvisor with all the different ones I have visited over the last 12 months!! Hubbie is okay but pretty stressed - bless him he said if he could he would take it  all off of me.  Last year one of our labradors was rushed to the vet the day I came home after surgery with a burst tumour in her stomach which would have been fatal if we hadn't got her to the vet as we did.  Now she has a growth on her eye and her paw which need operated on next week.  Think she is vying for being the centre of attention!! Jet xx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Hi Tess Sent you a PM - but so good to hear of the fab time you had.  It sounds like you had an amazing time.  We did Cairo and the Nile a few years ago but hubby got really ill and just has bad memories of the last 3 days (I think he thought I was going to leave him in one of the spare tombs!)  You must have just got back before all the volcanic disruption?  Do you feel recharged and re energised. As I said I had my hair extensions done last week and really pleased.  My own hair is growing thickly but randomly.  Where I didn't lose it  looked  very thin and see-through - so now have natural volume back but the same sort of length so looks really natural.  Took 4 hours but I now feel okay for my son's wedding.    Determined to look good despite having BC and an acoustic neuroma!!!  Plans are going well - just hope that flights are back on track as my sister is coming over from Perth. Edith - how is your hubby doing?  I have been in contact with someone in the States who has opted for the same treatment as I will have and so far so good. Jet xx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Tessa - thanks so much - just reading your reply helped me - not that I wish anyone else to go through this but you were so positive.  Fortunately hubby forgot I had an appt yesterday and was out so unless he asks I will not say anything until we get back - nothing we can do and I will try and forget?!  I went private so if I had been referred on NHS I wouldn't have even had the initial appt yet so determined to enjoy the sun. Sods law only 1 in 100,000 get this.....!  And I had medullary cancer which apparently is pretty rate as well. I am going to a salon called Lucinda Ellery in London as they  specialise with ladies who have had chemo and offer a weave as well as medi extensions.  I had a consultation as  I don't want to damage my hair.  They like it to be 4 in long for extensions.  I wore a cold cap but lost about 50% volume and bald patches on the crown but parts of it are now about jaw length and bald patches have gone. To anyone who didn't know it just looks very thin and over processed (actually pretty naff!) but it is growing.  I am waiting until April to have them put in a month before the wedding and then I will have had 2 months more growth.  Can't wait. Thanks again Tess - I will join you with the champagne to the future!!! Jetxx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Hi How are your extensions Tess?  Are you pleased with them? Feeling exhausted as back from the appt in Cambridge.  Was with the neurosurgeon for 2 hours whilst he explained everything.  He would prefer surgery in my case but due to the BC and obvious complications has suggested radiotherapy treatment or a rescan in 12 months.  Will meet with that onc (different from my BC one) in a few weeks to discuss and maybe it is something I will opt for in the autumn once I feel stronger (there is 90% success rate of stopping ~AN and/or decreasing the size).  lol Jetxx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Hi Tessa Oh.... what a disappointment for you.  I know when I went along for my consultation they said they couldn't do fringes.  I know exactly how you feel -  it is countdown 6 weeks for my appointment which will be 3 months from the original consultation in January.  I am 3 months in front of you and my hair has noticeably got thicker over the last couple of months - probably anyone who didn't know what my hair was like before would just think it was  thin and lacklustre - it is about jaw length.  And hair grows quicker in the warmer (!) weather so you may not have to wait as long. Am on the AN website but nobody has mentioned about hair loss - tumour is behind ear - not sure how they will target it.  Prefer the option of a bald patch to the horrific facial palsy that can be experienced through surgery and you are right about the 90% success rate. Lol Jet x
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed in March with 3.7 cm medullary breast cancer.  I have gone through lumpectomy, chemo, rads and am now on Herceptin for a year and Tamoxifan for 5 years.  I took 4 months off work but have been back more or less fulltime. I have coped with the SEs okay and have tried to be really positive.  My hair is just beginning to look 'normal' and I have planned to have extensions put in for my son's wedding in May.   Despite being pretty tired I have got back to normality.  I have experienced hearing loss so went to have it checked.  Have just been diagnosed with acoustic neuroma which I have looked up and is a form of brain tumour albeit benign!  This means an operation or rads both which can cause nerve problems.  Apparently it is slow growing but when I said I could leave it for a year  then he was definitely no you will need to get it sorted within a few months. What do I tell my kids and my husband who have worried about me for the last year?  My husband and I are treating ourselves to a luxury holiday for 2 weeks - as a way of getting over the awful last year.  He didn't come with me to the hospital (nothing to worry about I thought)  so I think I will leave telling him the gory details until we are on the way home - at least he will then have a good well deserved break. I feel absolutely gutted.  I have had my fill of hospitals and treatment and this is just as scary as the cancer. Just had to let it out as I can't tell anyone yet. Jet xx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Hi Tess Only 3 weeks until you crash out on that beach.  It will be wonderful - I hope you do get to swim with the dolphins.  Just seeing the sunshine and being warm is so theraputic.  Have you treated yourself to new cossies and beachwear? You sounded like me with your description of yourself  it did make me smile!  When I get my extensions I will send you a pic (or might wait until I get the false eyelashes as well) Went to see my GP today cos have been a bit down - and she said that she wouldn't have the op if she were in my place.  Had a really good conversation with her and  talked with a guy who had had radiotherapy - who has had no side effects and AN is dying 2 years on (did ask him about the hair but he said he was bald anyway so he couldn't answer.......!). Jetxx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies Saw a lovely lady onc who went through options and bascially said if she were in my shoes she would not have an operation (as did my GP) but radiotherapy was therefore the preferred option - just what I wanted to hear!  As it is a slow growing and benign she wants me to have completed my Herceptin before undertaking any treatment.  Have a fairly good margin in terms of time and will go for the plan that is called FSR which means Mon-Fri zapping for 6 weeks which has the least side effects and max benefits - and I have already done it with the BC - although I will have to stay over for during this time.   So all being well - and no major problems - will  probably start this time next year. Jetx
Posts.Title: What next?

Posts.Content: I had a lumpectomy wth further surgery to clear margin of 37mm Grade 3 tumour in April. I had yesterday my 5th of 6 FEC chemos and am now experiencing pain around the top end of the scar around my nipple (not had any pain there before). I phoned BCN who said take some paracetamol and see how it goes and if it is no better to phone Monday. Just scared that there my be further invasion so going to be a long weekend. Just wondered if anyone else has had anything like this? Many thanks. Jet xs
Posts.Title: Scar pain

Posts.Content: Hi Sally The shampoo is Philip Kingsley no scent no colour and suitable for hair whilst having chemo as it is very gentle. There is also a conditioner. My hairdresser uses his brand in his salon but I ordered it and the conditioner via the internet. My hair is shoulder length and fine so I haven't tried to style it at all. I found wearing a sleep hairnet a night helped (so attractive!), and a thinner one with a hairband during the day, keep stray hairs at bay. Although my hair is growing it is still shedding but much much less. Hope this helps. Jet xx
Posts.Title: Hair loss/cold cap and FEC-T

Posts.Content: I thought I might add my commets re cold cap. I am having 6 x FEC and my last one is next week. I have done the cold cap. Started losing hair at day 19 after first session and although it has thinned and is very fragile (I have fine hair) and I had some bald areas - I guess I have lost 30% volume I have washed my hair just once a week and used Philip Kingsley chemo shampoo and dead sea serum conditioner. I have tried to mitigate any stress to the hair and have not styled it at all - I have just afro combed it once a day and at home I wear an adjustable hairband that can cover more or less as you want, and when I go out I just push it under a wig (have even had compliments about how good my hair looks!) But the good news is that IT HAS ALREADY STARTED TO GROW AGAIN. So ladies - It is definitely worth perserving with. Good luck to you all.
Posts.Title: Hair loss/cold cap and FEC-T

Posts.Content: Hi Noj I am also on Herceptin. Started on  24th Sept but have never heard of Mugga scan.  I  saw the cardiologist to have an echo sound to check my heart before I started and thereafter every 3 months but it is just like a scan when you are pregnant - only around your heart.   I haven't been weighed at all or had any injection prior to the scan and it took max 20 mins.  I also see my Onc every 3 months.  No side effects from the Herceptin except a very runny nose.  I have my blood checked each time and the treatment time is just over the hour with the flushing out.  Also on Tamoxifan for 5 years. Jet x
Posts.Title: Newbie here
